name: Exploration Details
description: This table generates overland Exploration Details: environmental moments and features encountered along wilderness paths, roads, and frontier routes. Each result is a single sentence between 7 and 16 words that describes only what physically exists or occurs in the scene right now—landscape features, weather, traces of passage, brief events, sightings, or encounters. Do not state or imply outcomes, benefits, risks, safety, or usefulness in any way: avoid words and ideas like “could”, “might”, “offering”, “ready for use”, “edible”, “medicinal”, “fertile”, “drinkable”, “shelter”, “safe”, “dangerous”, “helpful”, or anything that evaluates how good or bad something is for travelers. Describe the world as if seen through a neutral lens that does not care about survival or advantage; any sense of opportunity, threat, or value must come entirely from later interpretation at the table.

tableData.result: A clear stream winds through the meadow, its waters sparkling under the midday sun.
Ancient ruins peek from overgrown vines along the forgotten trail.
Birds flock to berry bushes heavy with ripe fruit beside the path.
A sturdy bridge spans a rushing river, built from weathered stone.
